intro: Geranium pentandrum, commonly known as the five-stamen geranium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, pink to red flowers. The plant has palmately lobed leaves with a hairy texture, and its stems are often reddish in color. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Geranium pentandrum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
